  • Utilize SQL and other relevant tools to extract, build, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
  • Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses to support reporting and analysis.
  • Identify and address data quality issues, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data.


Reporting and Insights:

  • Design and generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate key metrics and insights.
  • Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
  • Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Collaborate with other teams, departments & the C-suite and to understand data requirements and business needs.
  • Work closely with the executive team to provide data-driven insights and support organizational goals.
  • Partner with IT colleagues to integrate data solutions and systems across the organization.


Problem Solving and Error Identification:

  • Proactively identify and address data discrepancies, errors, and issues.
  • Troubleshoot technical problems related to data extraction, transformation, and reporting.
  • Develop and implement solutions to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and usability.


Mission Alignment and Attitude:

  • Embrace and uphold the mission and values of the law firm, demonstrating a genuine commitment to helping individuals achieve financial freedom.
  • Maintain a positive and collaborative attitude while working with cross-functional teams.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality solutions.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
  • Strong working knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems required (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL). Other languages helpful, however SQL is prominent.
  • Proficiency in reporting tools.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and superiors.
  • Experience working in a mission-driven organization or a passion for serving others is preferred.


Join our dynamic and mission-focused team, where you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact while utilizing your technical expertise and analytical skills. We work on-site in our Financial District office Monday-Thursday and remotely on Fridays. If you're ready to contribute to our mission of helping Americans get out of debt, we encourage you to apply!


Compensation: Starting salary range of $50,000 – $65,000 depending on relevant experience. We hold bi-annual performance reviews to ensure we are actively identifying top performers, providing formal feedback and assessing merit increases.


How to Apply: To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a member of our team will reach out to you. We appreciate all applications, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


EEO Compliance: Consumer Legal Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst in Juno Beach, FL. Overview: The Data Analyst serves as a critical member of data integrity team within digital solutions group and supplies detailed analysis on key data elements that flow between systems to help design governance and master data management strategies and ensure data cleanliness.

Requirements


Significant data analysis/data integrity/data governance skills and proficiency/expertise in analytical tools including Power BI development, Python, coding, Excel, SQL, SOQL, Jira, and others
Must be detail oriented, focused on excellent quality deliverables and able to analyze data quickly using multiple tools and strategies including creating advanced algorithms


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Pharmacy Data Analyst
Description:
In partnership with the contracting and technology teams, you will: 


Work with both internal and external stakeholders to evaluate the financial impact of various Evio initiatives and strategic partnerships using best-practice modeling. 
Create standard reporting outputs, models, and customized summaries to assist Evio’s investor plans and internal teams. 
Identify opportunities and recommend innovative solutions based on insights gained from your modeling and analysis.
Facilitate data ingestion and standardization of critical medical drug rebate data extracts received from the Evio investor plans.
Complete rigorous reconciliations of Evio investor plans’ medical drug rebate data submissions and the invoicing and payment reports received from third parties.
Partner with the contracting team to manage the relationship between Evio and third parties managing Evio plans’ medical drug rebate processing. 
Work independently and efficiently in the role. 


The skills and experience you bring to this role include:


Bachelor's degree in a field relevant to analytics (i.e. business, computer science, statistics, finance, information systems)
2+ years of experience as a data analyst at a PBM or health plan.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and SQL and/or similar business analytic or modeling tools.
Superior problem-solving capabilities and learning agility with an attention to detail. 
Experience working with medical claims data and/or medical drug rebates.
Familiarity with Medispan (or First Databank) and medical coding (HCPCs, CPTs) systems and applying these codes in analytics.
Collaborative team player mentality with a passion for using data to inform decisions.
Experience in working with large, complex databases and process automation.
Work independently and efficiently in role.


Salary Considerations

Anticipated annual base pay range: $80,000 - $90,000

At Evio, we’re committed to building a competitive compensation package to honor the value our teammates bring as well as attract and retain top talent that is aligned with our culture, mission, and values. Compensation includes base pay (range shown) and an annual incentive bonus based on performance. Please note that the base pay information shown is a general guideline for the job responsibilities and qualifications listed. Salary decisions are based on candidate experience, and market and business considerations.

Evio Benefits


Great Health Insurance The company pays 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for teammates, and 50% for dependents.
401K Match Evio matches 100% of teammate contribution up to 5% of salary, subject to IRS limits. 401K is administered through Guideline.
Time Off We have a flexible vacation policy for teammates to unplug and recharge when you need it. There is no minimum or maximum amount of vacation allowed per year, and there is no payment in consideration for unused vacation. Vacation is to be used at your discretion, with approval of leadership.
Parental Leave Generous paid leave for new parents (includes birth and non-birth parents).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

Position: Data Analyst

Job Location: NewRez LLC, Coppell, Texas

Job Duties

Maintain responsibility for designated group of operational departments or third-party clients by identifying and implementing new operational or client-based business strategies. Contribute to the creation, design, and implementation of value-add business strategies that affect current operating practices and company policy in team-oriented collaborative environments. Maintain responsibility for key operational risk-management metrics including investigating and coordinating the resolution of any operational issues that are discovered. Participate in projects designed to improve operational performance and deliver excellent client service while assisting internal operations units. Convey new ideas to performance managers and understanding potential obstacles to implementation. Perform query optimization and performance tuning. Clearly articulate and present ideas and findings to a varied audience including the operations staff and senior management. In connection with above duties, utilize experience in the following: Visualizing data in Tableau; SQL programming; Software, data analysis, and visualization skills, including Excel (graphs, pivot tables, formulas, statistical analysis), SQL, Tableau, and writing effective and efficient queries and meaningful visualization; Industrial knowledge, including origination side of the business; and Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio.

Requires related degree, experience and skills. Part of employee referral program.

**

Company Perks


15 Paid Time Off (PTO) days and 18 after 1st anniversary!
9 Paid Holidays
Employee Engagement Activities


Company Benefits


Medical (including Health Savings Account & Flexible Savings Account)
Dental - RX – Vision – Life, Disability Insurance – 401(k) Plan with company match! – Employee Assistance Plan
Performance-based Incentives
Pet Insurance
Advancement Opportunities


Newrez NOW


Our Corporate Social Responsibility program, Newrez NOW, empowers employees to become leaders in their communities through a robust program that includes volunteering, philanthropy, nonprofit grants, and more
1 Volunteer Time Off (VTO) day, company-paid volunteer day where all eligible employees may participate in a volunteer event with a nonprofit of their choice
Employee Matching Gifts Program: We will match monetary employee donations to eligible non-profit organizations, dollar-for-dollar, up to $1,000 per employee
Newrez Grants Program: Newrez hosts a giving portal where we provide employees an abundance of resources to search for an opportunity to donate their time or monetary contributions


Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

CA Privacy Policy

CA Notice at Collection

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

One of our clients in the telecommunications space is currently seeking a Data Analyst. This person would play a key part in: transforming project requirements into custom-formatted reports, analyzing business procedures and recommending specific types of data that can be used to improve upon them.




Responsibilities:

Collecting data from primary and secondary sources.
Applying statistical methods to analyze data and draw logical conclusions.
Utilizing tools to identify patterns and present findings to stakeholders.
Developing reports and presentations to explain data to stakeholders, IT representatives, and other data analysts.
Validating, linking, and ensuring the quality of imported data.
Handling data protection issues and processing confidential data in accordance with guidelines.
Confirming project requirements by studying client needs and collaborating with development and project teams.
Working closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and providing actionable insights to decision-makers.
Proactively analyzing data to answer key questions for stakeholders, identifying drivers of business performance, and highlighting areas for improved efficiency and productivity.
Creating and maintaining interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating reporting components from multiple data sources.




Qualifications and Skills:

Experience working with relational databases as a Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL, relational databases.
Experience with AWS is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
IntePros is excited to partner with a Fortune 200 Investment Banking and Financial Company in helping them identify a Data Analyst for a critical engagement in Lake Mary, FL.




The Data Analyst will support the Data Governance team support team to identify and execute the process and procedures to run Governance Forums and engagement efforts as needed.
This includes working with all lines of business and functions as well as senior level executives.
The incumbent will be responsible for supporting the governance forums, production of content, and develop and communicate messages across stakeholders.
This person will maintain and load content for SharePoint website and online portals and support team department communications to LOB and functions.
Must be dependable and reliable.

Universal metrics master change control board inventory in Callibra
Leveraging Jira for POM model SharePoint page
Jira, SharePoint, Confluence, Excel, Outlook
Developing and maintaining content

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
As aJunior Data Analystat HSP Direct, you will play a pivotal role in developing and optimizing mailing lists for our direct mail campaigns, with a primary focus on fundraising for conservative causes. You will ensure that our messages effectively reach and resonate with conservative individuals. You will embody the core principles that define our organization's culture and ethics, including acting with integrity, putting the client first, and maintaining the highest standards in every aspect of your work.

In this role, you are training to become an Audience Builder. You will be learning the direct mail process from building relationships with the client, idea creation, designing the letter, selecting the lists to mail, printing, analyzing results, and managing cash flow. Training involves, spending time with each of our core business sectors, shadowing Audience Builders, studying our returns and creativity, and mentorship provided by the Director of Audience Building. One major part of your job will be learning: 1) what data we have available. 2) how to access the data in our current tech infrastructure and 3) understanding the connection between the data you pull and the result of mailing those prospective donors.

Your average week will look like this:


10% shadowing Audience Builder
10% attending account team meetings
10% meeting with folks outside of the Audience Building
20% studying fundraising results and creative copy
40% selecting data for Housefile and Prospect Mailings
10% mentorship from the Director of Audience Building


Who are we?

HSP Direct is a best-in-class full-service direct mail fundraising agency offering online fundraising, production services, graphic design, and list and data services through our affiliated companies. With over 100 non-profit and political clients, we’re seeking highly motivated team members who share our passion for conservative politics.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Selection:Select data quickly and accurately so that our client can not only meet their mail date but also meet their fundraising goals
Direct Mail Research:Understanding what techniques and messaging work best for each organization and see how those lists perform
Audience Research:Conduct thorough research to understand the conservative target audience. Understand the 'why' behind list strategies, including how each list is a part of a longer-term strategy for the client
Collaboration:Work closely with the campaign and creative teams, honoring commitments, and being accountable for delivering accurate, reliable lists aligned with conservative messaging and fundraising objectives
Curiosity and Continuous Learning:Challenge what you don't understand, asking questions that push for excellence and result in the best possible solutions. Seek every opportunity to gain knowledge and increase skills, all with the goal of fundraising for conservative causes


Qualifications:


Proven experience in audience segmentation, data analysis, or direct mail list strategy, with a focus on fundraising for conservative causes
Strong understanding of conservative principles and values
Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills
A passion for advancing conservative causes and values while embodying the core principles of our organization


If this challenge seems like a great fit for you and you would like a promising career path, please apply with a cover letter, resume, and salary requirements.Cover letter is required for consideration.

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Description:
The Data/Information Mgt Analyst 2 is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.

Responsibilities:


This function covers incumbents responsible for various data activities, which include database administration, data analysis, maintenance, data quality, and database management or database architecture / design engineering
Responsible for routine operational or administrative work
Day-to-day actions are focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation
Individuals will have their work thoroughly reviewed and checked by more senior incumbents and will have limited contact outside their immediate area
Daily deliverable of routine and defined outputs, while at the same time developing knowledge of the broader context in which the work is being performed
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.


Qualifications:


0-2 years relevant experience
Know-how on analytic tools (SAS E-miner, Knowledge Seeker, SPSS etc.)
Big data and machine learning experiences are (R, Python etc.)
The ability to engage resources outside of their direct control to achieve objectives


Education:


Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience
Esta función cubre a los titulares a cargo de diversas actividades de datos, incluida la administración de base de datos, análisis de datos, mantenimiento, calidad de datos y gestión de base de datos o arquitectura de base de datos/ingeniería de diseño.
Realiza trabajo administrativo u operativo de rutina.
Realiza acciones cotidianas enfocadas en la administración de procedimientos, análisis y preparación de informes definidos.
Un titular con mayor nivel jerárquico revisará y verificará el trabajo de la persona con detenimiento y tendrá contacto limitado fuera de su área inmediata.
Evaluar adecuadamente el riesgo cuando se toman decisiones comerciales, demostrando una consideración particular por la reputación de la empresa y protegiendo a Citigroup, sus clientes y activos, al impulsar el cumplimiento de las leyes, las reglas y los reglamentos correspondientes, acatando la política, aplicando un juicio ético sólido en relación con el comportamiento personal, la conducta y las prácticas comerciales y escalando, administrando e informando los problemas de control con transparencia.
Aptitudes
Entre 1 a 3 años de experiencia relevante.
Capacidad de pensar de forma analítica.

The Data/Information Mgt Analyst 2 is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.

Responsibilities:

  • This function covers incumbents responsible for various data activities, which include database administration, data analysis, maintenance, data quality, and database management or database architecture / design engineering
  • Responsible for routine operational or administrative work
  • Day-to-day actions are focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation
  • Individuals will have their work thoroughly reviewed and checked by more senior incumbents and will have limited contact outside their immediate area
  • Daily deliverable of routine and defined outputs, while at the same time developing knowledge of the broader context in which the work is being performed
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

  • 0-2 years relevant experience
  • Know-how on analytic tools (SAS E-miner, Knowledge Seeker, SPSS etc.)
  • Big data and machine learning experiences are (R, Python etc.)
  • The ability to engage resources outside of their direct control to achieve objectives

Education:

  • Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience
  • Esta función cubre a los titulares a cargo de diversas actividades de datos, incluida la administración de base de datos, análisis de datos, mantenimiento, calidad de datos y gestión de base de datos o arquitectura de base de datos/ingeniería de diseño.
  • Realiza trabajo administrativo u operativo de rutina.
  • Realiza acciones cotidianas enfocadas en la administración de procedimientos, análisis y preparación de informes definidos.
  • Un titular con mayor nivel jerárquico revisará y verificará el trabajo de la persona con detenimiento y tendrá contacto limitado fuera de su área inmediata.
  • Evaluar adecuadamente el riesgo cuando se toman decisiones comerciales, demostrando una consideración particular por la reputación de la empresa y protegiendo a Citigroup, sus clientes y activos, al impulsar el cumplimiento de las leyes, las reglas y los reglamentos correspondientes, acatando la política, aplicando un juicio ético sólido en relación con el comportamiento personal, la conducta y las prácticas comerciales y escalando, administrando e informando los problemas de control con transparencia.
  • Aptitudes
  • Entre 1 a 3 años de experiencia relevante.
  • Capacidad de pensar de forma analítica.
  • Conocimiento en productos bancarios.
  • Proactivo, colaborativo, creativo con habilidades de negociación, lógico y organizado, resiliencia y adaptación al cambio.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Systems Analyst Job Duties:

Supports digital equity project tasks that pertains to reviewing global frameworks and concept mapping to Virginia Beach community and Hampton Roads region
Supports data aggregation, cleaning, wrangling, preparation and use basic skills to analyze and formulate city data using statistical and other methods to provide insights through data and predictive analytics
Supports creation of visualizations through story telling of data derived from emerging Internet of things (IoT) sensor technologies and open data registries with data pertaining to Smart Cities
Supports creation of basic governance model concepts and documentation for climate resilience through the creation of and engaging in support of communication and branding
Supports research in identifying disparate variables to support and bring resilience to underserved communities in closing the digital divide and other community needs gaps through innovative ideas aligning with the sustainable goals
Supports research in review and creation of parameters that influence and enhance biodiversity and biophilic nature of the city through review of the biodiversity index and identification of multiple factors with a local perspective
Supports and provides feedback of Accelerated Analytics

Familiar with machine learning using scripting languages such as Python, R, or similar.

• Familiar with visualization tools and cloud environments.

• Possess strong written and verbal communication skills, a positive attitude, and a willingness to learn.




Minimum/Special/Additional Requirements:

Requires any combination of education (above the high school level) and/or experience equivalent to six (6) years in fields utilizing the required knowledge, skills, and abilities listed above, including at least three (2) years of recent, experience in using varied data from different field and visualization using above mentioned techniques.

Preferred Qualifications:

Degree in fields related to Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, Econometrics, Management or related.
6+ years proven experience in science, management, math, modeling, and statistics to drive significant impact and communication through story telling for digital equity and smart city projects
Good business acumen and scientific understanding of data and parameters influencing climate resilience through science with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven quantitative analysis
Strong familiarity and experience with data preparation, data wrangling and processing – such as assessment of data quality, and dimensionality reduction, etc.
Capable of delivering creative analysis, solutions and socializing complicated concepts to both technical and non-technical partners
Basic knowledge in SQL or other programming languages such as python. Some development experience in at least one scripting language.
Basic familiarity with relational databases and SQL-like query languages methodologies and provide concise thoughts into proposals, recommendations and findings
Demonstrated strong written, verbal communication, and presentation skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Fully Remote

5+ month contract (Likely Extension)

$90-$100/HR W2 DOE







Job Summary

We are looking for a senior data scientist to use quantitative background to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. This individual will be driving the efforts on the Growth team, which enables the company to seamlessly talk to its users to maximize the long-term impact. We build features that help scale how we communicate and target users across different user lifecycles. This role will drive scaling adoption of platform usage through experimentation, identifying opportunities through exploratory analysis and measuring incremental impact. You will have to work closely with cross functional teams (like product and engineering) and if you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, and have experience using analytics to affect revenue, growth, marketing or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!




We’re excited about you because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or similar domain

6 to 9 years of experience in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role




Skills :

Required

-Expertise with SQL, A/B Testing & Experimentation




Nice to Have

- Statistical analysis (e.g. hypothesis testing, experimentation, regressions) using tools like R or Python

- Understanding of causal inference methodologies (e.g. match markets, synthetic control) and other experimentation/quasi-experimentation methods preferred

- Basic understanding of brand marketing, marketing channels and metrics would be preferred

- Proficiency in one or more analytics & visualization tools (e.g. Sigma, Looker, Tableau)

- The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way

- The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment with good communication skills

- Able to work in a fast-paced work environment, detail oriented and can independently deal with ambiguous issues on your own.







Pride Global offers eligible employee’s comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), supplemental coverage (accident insurance, critical illness insurance and hospital indemnity), 401(k)-retirement savings, life & disability insurance, an employee assistance program, legal support, auto, home insurance, pet insurance and employee discounts with preferred vendors.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are...

SafeBasements is a basement waterproofing and foundation repair service provider and product manufacturer, and an innovator in both client satisfaction and product dependability. Acquired by Percheron Capital in 2023, we are looking for talented team members to be a part of our exciting growth plans!




What we need...

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst with a strong background in business analysis and experience creating impactful data visualizations. The ideal candidate will possess a keen analytical mind, attention to detail, and the ability to transform complex data sets into clear, actionable insights through compelling visual representations.




What you'd do...




Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data and present findings to stakeholders through reports and visualizations.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing data validation and quality checks.
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data visualization and analysis.




What you'd need...

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field; relevant experience can be substituted.
2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Experience with SQL and querying databases.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.




This position is based in our office in St Louis Park, MN. Because we are in the early stages of building our Corporate team, we have found it valuable to be together in the office Monday-Thursday, and most of us work remotely on Fridays. We all have flexibility to work remotely on ad hoc days as personal demands arise.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Location: Savannah GA 31406

Onsite Requirements:

Running SQL queries to pull data from Snowflake
Build reporting from data using Qlik
Strong understanding of business metrics/KPIs

Job Description:

Essential Functions / Duties Performed Regularly:

Analyze and interpret data from various marketing campaigns to uncover trends, patterns, and insights related to performance and identify areas for improvement.
Monitor and evaluate call center metrics, such as call volumes, service levels, customer satisfaction, and resolution times.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing effectiveness.
Collaborate with marketing teams to design and implement A/B testing frameworks and measure the impact of various campaigns.
Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize marketing spend and improve return on investment (ROI).
Work with customer service managers to improve call center operations and customer engagement strategies.
Utilize advanced analytics techniques to forecast trends and model potential outcomes of marketing and customer service initiatives.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in analytics and performance marketing tools.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Work Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within a marketing or advertising context.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
Statistical Knowledge: Proficiency in statistical tests, distributions, and regression analysis.
Data Visualization: Skill in creating clear visual representations of data using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
SQL: Strong command of SQL for querying databases.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages - SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools.
Machine Learning: Understanding of basic machine learning algorithms and their application in marketing data.
A/B Testing: Experience in designing and interpreting A/B tests to optimize campaign performance.
Data Mining: Ability to extract data from various sources and prepare it for analysis
Strong communication skills: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Physical Requirements:

Standing, walking, sitting, movement and use of mechanical controls, such as keyboard, are frequently required.

** 3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.

This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future **

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The DBI team specializes in the evaluation of damaged structures. DBI’s construction experts provide independent recommendations and analysis to clients in the insurance and legal industry. Hard evidence, expertise, and accuracy drive work; communication and connection are the company’s top priorities. In a complex industry, the company’s mission is to bring clarity to every client served by DBI.




The Data Analyst will work act as the subject matter expert (SME) on report writing, report visualization, data requests, and owning complex data projects. The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining dashboards, as well as testing custom created platforms and troubleshooting.




PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Design and implement new reporting and dashboards to assist teams’ ability to perform their job and to provide actionable insights in a scalable and sustainable way.
Maintain and oversee all existing dashboards and reports.
Optimize and troubleshoot reports and dashboards for performance, quality, and data integrity. Work with external developer when necessary.
Provide support to team to ensure availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards.
Write reports utilizing data visualizations and dashboards derived from a large volume of data, ensuring accuracy and precision, reconciling data to ensure accuracy in all tasks.
Act as subject matter expert of company’s available datasets, spanning a range of data and data types.
Perform audit in production to ensure data is accurate and identify areas that require quality control.
Run ad-hoc data requests.
Identify areas to improve overall efficiency and data integrity, across departments.
Continually improve and augment reporting; increase reporting as new data becomes available.
Be agile in learning new skills and technologies as required for the role.
Perform duties with low supervision, taking initiative to accomplish team objectives/goals.
Uphold the values of DBI Construction Consultants and the culture espoused by Our Foundation.
Consistently demonstrates professionalism, integrity and the highest standards of ethical behavior and professional conduct; conducts oneself in a manner that reflects favorably on the organization.
Maintain the confidentiality of proprietary and sensitive information, exercising sound judgment and discretion in any disclosure of information related to DBI Construction Consultants and its endeavors.
Commits to continuous improvement and professional development for self and team members.
Perform all other duties as assigned.




REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

A bachelor’s degree in computer science, or relevant data technology field.
Three (3) Years of relevant work experience in software development, database, analytical tools, and report writing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.
Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with users at all levels of the organization.
Ability to work under pressure, independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities simultaneously.




SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Experience creating dashboards and self-service capabilities for stakeholders through reporting tools (Power Bi, etc.).
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics and differentiate between correlation and causation.
Proven understanding of python, especially libraries and packages focused on data processing, as well as analysis.
Proficient in PowerBI, SharePoint, and Microsoft Office with ability to use Excel's advanced functions.
Experience in DevExpress, SQL and distributed files systems, as well as using multiple data sources.
Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming/scripting languages.
Ability to recognize opportunities for process improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions.
Analytical ability for data gathering, transformation, and complex analysis.
Eagerness to learn, well-organized, and detail oriented.
Navigate large datasets and work with multiple data sets and sources.
Ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to diverse collaborators.




WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work is conducted primarily in an indoor office environment with protection from weather conditions and with exposure to noise typical of an office or administrative setting.







PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS:

Work requires light lifting (10 – 15 lbs.), standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching, fingering (keyboarding) and repetitive hand motion, grasping, talking, and hearing at normal speaking levels. Work requires visual acuity to read and prepare data and figures, transcribe words and numbers, view information on a computer terminal, read, operate office machines, and determine the accuracy and thoroughness of work.




The Data Analyst is required to work in the DBI New York or Atlanta office from 9:00AM - 6:00PM ET in order to accommodate occasional meetings and work activities.




Salary: 72K+

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Recognized as a 2024 Top Workplace by the Tennessean, EnableComp is the leading source of revenue cycle management solutions for complex claims in the US. We proudly partner with well over 1000+ hospitals across the US to help them maximize their revenue from complex claims.

Our Mission

We partner with healthcare providers to maximize reimbursement from complex claims payers by having the best people, processes, products and performance.

Our Vision

We enable healthcare providers to do what they do best.

Position Summary

The Data Analyst responsibilities will include but not limited to quantitative analysis and predictive modeling of healthcare data to provide management with statistical findings and conclusions.  The ideal candidate should be able to develop, collect and analyze metrics and data to formulate fact-based decisions and proactively implement process improvements through analysis of claim and operational data.




Key Responsibilities
Ability to transform complex datasets into executive-level summaries, and communicate findings clearly and succinctly
Managing multiple projects and deadlines so you will need excellent time management and prioritization skills to meet multiple deadlines
Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills; strong understanding of analytics results, as well as the ability to identify a problem and develop and execute new solutions to obtain results
Effectively communicate results to key stakeholders and policy makers; communication of results include clean and well-organized presentations to reflect analytic methods used and to illustrate key decision points with sufficient detail to support comprehension and replication of the analysis
Data responsibilities include identifying necessary data elements to build measures, querying data to limit large data sets, joining tables to build analytic views, other data prep, and documentation of process and results; working with external data management team to receive, load, and analyze new data
Ability to communicate with BA and IT to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers and document work product
Solid hands-on experience and knowledge of database concepts
Ability to work independently given minimal direction
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation, as well as the ability to step back and see the big picture
Other duties as required




Requirements and Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years’ experience with analytics, reporting, and relational databases
2 years’ experience working in a healthcare, SaaS or other similar environment.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL Server
Familiarity with healthcare terminology such as diagnosis code, CPT, claim ID, DRG, inpatient, outpatient, etc.
Experience with BI tool (Power BI/Tableau/Qlik)
Experience with statistical models and predictive analytics
Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
Must have strong computer proficiency and understand how to use basic office applications, including MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
Regular and predictable attendance.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Special Considerations and Prerequisites
Strong communication and presentation skills; ability to explain complex analytic results to an audience of varying levels of technical understanding required
Exceptional attention to detail and work product validation
Strong planning, organizational, and multi-tasking skills
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills, written and verbal
Ownership of body of work







EnableComp is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. All applicants will be considered for this position based upon experience and knowledge, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.

EnableComp recruits, develops and retains the industry's top talent.  As the employer of choice in the complex claims industry, EnableComp takes pride in our continuous commitment to building and maintaining a culture centered around fostering the professional growth and development of our people.  We believe that investing in our employees is the key to our success, and we are dedicated to providing them with the tools, resources, and support they need to thrive and grow their career here. At EnableComp, we are committed to living up to our core values each and every day, and we believe that this commitment is what sets us apart from other companies.  If you are looking for a company that values its employees and is dedicated to helping them achieve their full potential, then EnableComp is the place for you.

 Don’t just take our word for it!  Hear what our people are saying:

“I love my job because everyone shares the same vision and is determined and dedicated. People care about you as a person and your professional growth. There is a genuine spirit of cooperation and shared goals all revolving around helping each other.” – Revenue Specialist

“I enjoy working for EnableComp because of the Core Values we believe in. EnableComp stands true to these values from empowering employees to ecstatic clients. This company is family oriented and flexible, along with understanding the balance of work, life, and fun.” – Supervisor, Operations

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST (Quality/Cleansing)

100% Remote - 3 month contract + possible extension

Los Angeles, CA

*no corp-to-corp or sponsorships please!




As a Data Analyst, you will support efforts to ensure the overall quality of data used in the company’s customer relationship management (CRM) system. You will conduct ongoing processes to ensure the cleanliness of CRM data used across the organization. This includes performing regular data cleansing activities (merging, purging, and deduping of existing and incoming CRM Data) as well as researching companies and contact information to ensure existing data is formatted accurately to meet business standards. You will work effectively with the CRM team to address data inconsistencies, and be a key contributor to developing solutions to enhance and improve data integrity, ensuring data standards are developed and maintained. You will also support the business and system re-engineering and architecture development to define future data needs.




Responsibilities:

Assist in the overall quality of the company’s CRM data
Proactively identify and correct data quality issues
Use variety of tools including CRM Fusion Demand Tools
Manage the process of inserting, merging, and updating records in CRM system (Salesforce)
Create SQL queries and Salesforce reports to find and review Salesforce data issues for cleansing
Review researched results for accuracy and update Salesforce appropriately
Import new company and contact lists into Salesforce to standardize data and create related records to support new employee onboarding, ongoing maintenance, and marketing efforts
Complete special data cleansing and integration projects
Provide data metrics and health check of Salesforce
Assist in the verification of data loading
Deliver detail-oriented approach to data hygiene processes and recording of updates
Identify areas of concern and present proposed solutions to management
Projects and other duties as assigned




Requirements:

Understanding of data governance, data quality, and data hygiene processes
Basic understanding of CRM applications and technology
Proficient using MS Office suite (Excel skills required)
Motivated, detail-oriented, and passionate about data
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze problems and devise viable solutions
Ability to collaborate with colleagues and be a team-player
Demonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects
Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to communicate effectively and confidently at all levels
BA/BS Computer Science / Business / MIS (or equivalent work experience to substitute for education)




Preferred Requirements:

Experience with complex data structures and Relational Databases desired
SQL skills, MS SQL preferred
Salesforce or other CRM system experience a strong plus
Previous experience with the investment banking, management consulting, or other professional services industry a strong plus

Title: Analyst, Advanced Analytics
Description:
Job Description

You will contribute to the development of intelligent data platforms for a top tier global organization. You will work with client leaders to understand their business problems and consult on data driven solutions.

You will build complex data pipelines to process very large data sets across hundreds of features and deliver actionable insights at scale.

Typical problem statements involve (a mix of) measuring impact of interventions on marketing or product out comes, applying market data to inform strategic strategies around pricing and assortments and developing intuitive data stories to guide granular visibility into marketing, operational and performance.

You will need technical skills to find data driven solutions, and consulting experience to perform problem inquiry and synthesize of analytical outcomes, to present insights to senior leaders driving actionability and improvement.

You will report to the director on the team.

Main Responsibilities:


Code custom packages, pipelines, testing & auditing frameworks using Python & SQL, that follow industry best practices in Python & SQL
Research and build new algorithms making appropriate use of baseline, ensemble, and deep learning techniques
Work with clients to discuss and understand their needs; work with clients to achieve business impact/excellence by helping them implement data driven solutions
Own the implementation of data science solutions and drive automation of commonly occurring requests
Support business development initiatives (building proposals for new projects)


Qualifications


1 - 3 years of experience across software development, analytics and consulting services
Great programming fundamentals
High proficiency in modelling using Python
Proficiency in complex querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis using SQL
Excellent written and verbal skills, as this role is heavily client-facing
Strong problem solving and consulting skills
Detail oriented with right balance in quality and speed of delivery
Bachelor’s in computer science (preferred) or any other engineering; Advanced degree preferred


Additional Information

The anticipated salary range for this position is $59,000 - $96,025. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other factors permitted by law. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit dentsubenefitsplus.com

Dentsu (the "Company") is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee of the Company, on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done that will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing an undue hardship on the Company. Please contact recruiting@dentsuaegis.com if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process or to request or discuss an accommodation in connection with a job at the Company to which you are applying.

Dentsu is an integrated growth and transformation partner to the world’s leading organizations. Founded in 1901 in Tokyo, Japan, and now present in over 145 countries and regions, it has a proven track record of nurturing and developing innovations, combining the talents of its global network of leadership brands to develop impactful and integrated growth solutions for clients. Dentsu delivers end-to-end experience transformation (EX) by integrating its services across Media, CXM and Creative, while its business transformation (BX) mindset pushes the boundaries of transformation and sustainable growth for brands, people and society.

Dentsu, Innovating to Impact.

Description:
Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze data to identify trends and insights.
Create reports and visualizations to communicate data findings.
Work with various stakeholders to understand data needs and objectives.
Develop and maintain databases and data systems.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a SaaS start-up that is looking to expand their Engineering team. The data team collaborates closely with all other engineering teams, providing crucial support, making this position exciting as you get to work on many different projects. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in building the platform technology and infrastructure that drives our product delivery.




Responsibilities:




Developing and maintaining metrics and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
Identifying key insights to drive improvements in our processes and systems.
Monitoring system performance and ensuring data integrity.
Detecting, prioritizing, and resolving systemic issues to improve data quality.







Requirements:




Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience with analytics software such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Ability to work independently and strong communication skills
Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision and oversee complex tasks while prioritizing multiple projects based on strategic goals.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Associate
Description:
The Associate will join our Boston office as a member of the Data, Analytics and Performance Reporting. This individual will be a key part of the team responsible for calculating and producing performance reports for our proprietary pooled vehicles. The Associate will focus on investment product data, including setup, reconciliation, analysis and governance, ultimately culminating in production of quarterly performance reporting packages.

The Data, Analytics and Performance Reporting Team is responsible for:

Institutionalizing data, analytics and performance reporting in support of our investment team, including proprietary managed vehicles.
Ensuring that the data required to support our investment programs is complete, current, accessible, and maintained in systems with a high degree of accuracy.
Preparing performance reporting for the Firm’s proprietary pooled vehicles on a regular basis.
In addition, this team works with our Data Management Team to identify and publish new data sets and to create and maintains business intelligence visualizations to support the Investment Research team.

The Associate will play a significant role in continued development of the firm’s recently onboarded private equity performance reporting platform. The Associate is expected to gain exposure to and have a full understanding of our investment process and to develop an understanding of all parts of the business. The Associate will also be expected to contribute to broader Firm development through participation in specific projects or initiatives. Ability to build strong cross-functional relationships is critical to success in this role.

Performance Reporting

Reconcile daily cash flows between internal and external platforms and resolve any discrepancies. Own responsibility for ensuring all parties are in receipt of notices and other fund communications
Source data, calculate, analyze and report pooled vehicle performance and exposures to internal teams. Maintain responsibility for updating exposure and performance information in central systems with a high degree of timeliness and accuracy
Perform validation and reconciliation to ensure consistent data across platforms, working across teams to resolve discrepancies where necessary
Develop standard reporting templates for the delivery of client-facing performance and exposure reporting
Document procedures to support reporting on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Collaborate with client facing teams to develop standard framework for reporting performance
Collaborate across the Firm on internal projects to improve the efficiency of performance reporting process
Ad hoc performance reporting as necessary to support client or business development needs

Data Management and Analytics

Ensure data is collected and captured within the established deadlines for the assigned investment products. Examples include maintaining dealing terms of investments, updating performance, tax implications, exposures and other key data for products on an ongoing basis
Assume responsibility for timely upkeep of critical research data sets, including manager exposures, holdings, dealing terms and custom fees
Work with investment professionals and develop visualization tools to automate analyses currently being performed manually in spreadsheets
Identify additional beneficial data sets, as well as process and automation improvements
Using visualization tools and available data sources, develop creative and rapid solutions to assist with a variety of custom and ad-hoc requests

Qualifications

Intellectually curious and energized by the prospect of solving business-wide operational challenges
1-3 years of experience in reconciliations, investment performance reporting or other high-accuracy, data intensive role
Experience calculating investment performance and attribution (TR and IRR) preferred
Demonstrated interest in finance and investment data
Strong quantitative skills and attention to detail required
SQL, Python, and/or PowerBI experience is a plus

  • Intellectually curious and energized by the prospect of solving business-wide operational challenges
  • 1-3 years of experience in reconciliations, investment performance reporting or other high-accuracy, data intensive role
  • Experience calculating investment performance and attribution (TR and IRR) preferred
  • Demonstrated interest in finance and investment data
  • Strong quantitative skills and attention to detail required
  • SQL, Python, and/or PowerBI experience is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

PrognomiQ is developing and commercializing transformative tests for early detection and treatment of cancer and other complex diseases. To accomplish this, we are leveraging proprietary, high-throughput genomics, proteomics, and small molecule assays to develop unprecedented molecular views of health and disease. We are a team of experienced and accomplished scientists supported by a group of leading investors in healthcare and technology.




Would you like to be at the leading edge of molecular data generation and analyses that changes how cancer and other complex diseases are detected and treated? Or are you looking to bring innovative and disruptive solutions to market? If you answer “yes” to either of these questions, let us know by applying!




Description of role

This is a hybrid work position with expectations of being onsite most days per week.
The ideal candidate will be independent, collaborative, and proactive in ensuring data quality and providing insights to clinical and laboratory teams.




Responsibilities:

Compile and analyze clinical and laboratory data related to daily operations.
Design and implement visualizations and dashboards for clinical and laboratory data.
Design and automate clinical and laboratory data quality checks.
Track down and resolve inconsistencies in clinical and laboratory data.
Connect disparate data systems to centralized, cloud-based data warehouses.
Contribute high-quality code to the codebase.
Communicate and collaborate with laboratory scientists, data scientists, and engineers.




Qualifications:

B.S. in a science or engineering discipline.
Proficiency with any dialect of SQL.
Some familiarity with at least one general purpose coding language such as Python or R.
Willingness to learn and grow in software engineering and data science.
Excellent, proactive communication and collaboration skills.




Equal Opportunity Employment

PrognomiQ is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital - New York
Description:
Description
Key Activities:


Independently conduct analysis in SQL & Tableau, sharing results and collaborating with clients, Efficio’s client facing teams, and Efficio’s technical experts
In addition to execution, proactively look for ways to build on the product. Some key skills we expect you to master are: streamlining the process (reducing time to delivery), increasing generalizability (via robust modular coding & design practices), and improving usability for our clients.
Present confidently to both internal and client teams about the analysis in a way that is persuasive to people of varying seniority and technical skill level. Develop knowledge and expertise in your focus area so you can become a trusted adviser to our clients.


Essential Requirements - Exemplary academic background in STEM or demonstrated excellence in analytics via independent project work


Proficiency in at least one of: Python, SQL, Matlab, R, or Java as demonstrated through coursework or independent work. This role will mainly be working with Python and SQL, however any proficiency in the other 3 languages will be acceptable as long as you are willing to learn
Expert in research, problem-solving, communication, & analysis
Record of leadership


Desirable Requirements - Strong visual & oral communicator with experience independently leading presentations on complex analytical topics


1+ Years in Python, SQL
Solid academic background in or independent understanding of fundamental programming concepts
Experience working in a high pressure environment


Please note applications for this role will close on 8th August 2024.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

POSITION DUTIES:

Analyze user’s data processing needs, manipulate or process large amounts of data using software applications, and convey the results of the data analysis to stakeholders. Position is based out of headquarters in Newark, DE but may be assigned to various unanticipated worksites throughout the US as determined by management.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Math, any Engineering or a related field.

HOURS: 40 hours/week; 9:00 a.m. – 5:30 p.m.

LOCATION OF EMPLOYMENT: Position is based out of headquarters located at 200 Continental Dr., Suite 401, Newark, DE 19713 but may be assigned to various unanticipated worksites throughout the US as determined by management.

CONTACT: To apply, please mail resume and cover letter referencing the ‘Data Analyst’ position to Venkat Manda, HR Coordinator, Ecclesiastes, Inc., 200 Continental Dr., Suite 401, Newark, DE 19713.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Compensation: $130k-160k/year

Location: Remote

Data Analyst:

Inceed has partnered with a great company to help find a skilled Data Analyst to join their team!

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working closely with various business units, leveraging your analytical expertise to uncover insights, analyze problems, and develop data-driven solutions.

Responsibilities:


Data Analysis and Exploration:
Utilize strong SQL skills to extract, transform, and analyze data from diverse sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Interpret and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Statistical Analysis:
Apply fundamental statistical concepts to analyze and interpret data.
Design and conduct hypothesis testing and other statistical experiments.
Provide statistical insights to guide decision-making processes.
Collaboration with Business Units:
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and challenges.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define analytical requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Translate business questions into analytical approaches and present findings effectively.
Problem Solving and Solution Development:
Analyze complex business problems and develop data-driven solutions.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to facilitate decision-making.
Implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms as needed.

Required Qualifications & Experience:


achelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on SQL.
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


If you are interested in learning more about the Data Analyst opportunity, please submit your resume for consideration. Our client is unable to provide sponsorship at this time.

We are Inceed, a staffing and direct placement firm who believes in the possibility of something better. Our mission is simple: We’re here to help every person, whether client, candidate, or employee, find and secure what’s better for them.

Inceed is an equal opportunity employer. Inceed prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Reports to: Director of IT




We are a mission-driven law firm dedicated to assisting Americans in overcoming financial challenges. Our inhouse IT team plays a critical role in all aspects of our daily work including streamlining our workflow and enhancing operational efficiency.




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst who has great working knowledge with SQL and data visualization to join our team. It is imperative that this person is comfortable and well versed in working collaboratively and cross functionally with other departments. The IT team supports all functions of the business, communication skills are paramount.




You will be responsible for managing data, generating reports, and providing valuable insights to support decision-making across the organization. This position requires strong technical expertise in SQL, attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, relationship building and a commitment to our mission and values.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Management and Analysis:

Utilize SQL and other relevant tools to extract, build, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses to support reporting and analysis.
Identify and address data quality issues, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data.




Reporting and Insights:

Design and generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate key metrics and insights.
Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Collaborate with other teams, departments & the C-suite and to understand data requirements and business needs.
Work closely with the executive team to provide data-driven insights and support organizational goals.
Partner with IT colleagues to integrate data solutions and systems across the organization.




Problem Solving and Error Identification:

Proactively identify and address data discrepancies, errors, and issues.
Troubleshoot technical problems related to data extraction, transformation, and reporting.
Develop and implement solutions to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and usability.




Mission Alignment and Attitude:

Embrace and uphold the mission and values of the law firm, demonstrating a genuine commitment to helping individuals achieve financial freedom.
Maintain a positive and collaborative attitude while working with cross-functional teams.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality solutions.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong working knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems required (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL). Other languages helpful, however SQL is prominent.
Proficiency in reporting tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and superiors.
Experience working in a mission-driven organization or a passion for serving others is preferred.




Join our dynamic and mission-focused team, where you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact while utilizing your technical expertise and analytical skills. We work on-site in our Financial District office Monday-Thursday and remotely on Fridays. If you're ready to contribute to our mission of helping Americans get out of debt, we encourage you to apply!




Compensation: Starting salary range of $50,000 – $65,000 depending on relevant experience. We hold bi-annual performance reviews to ensure we are actively identifying top performers, providing formal feedback and assessing merit increases.




How to Apply: To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a member of our team will reach out to you. We appreciate all applications, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




EEO Compliance: Consumer Legal Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Oak Brook, IL (100% onsite)

Salary: 75k – 80k

Duration: Permanent Hire

Status: Exempt

Reports To: Director of MIS

Purpose

To collect and analyze data in order to create meaningful information that the company can use to improve and grow.

Essential

Job Functions


Oversees and manages a program of projects focused on sourcing new datasets, building a controls framework ensuring those datasets have high quality ratings.
Proactively analyzes data to answer key questions for stakeholders on what drives business performance; investigates and communicates which areas need improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Drives an understanding of and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions.
Plans and executes data catalog and data quality-related activities using a combination of vendor and in-house tools.
Utilizes excellent data analysis skills with proficiency in SQL programming language.
Creates and maintains existing reporting infrastructure (SAP BI Platform).
Accurately and efficiently translates business data and process requirements into reporting solutions (Crystal Reports).
Works closely with others as-needed to understand and maintain focus on analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and delivers actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Designs, develops, and deploys Tableau dashboards and reports to meet company business requirements, objectives, and goals.
Works with senior leadership teams to define best practices, gather requirements, provide status updates, and strengthen data analysis function.


Other Functions


Performs other related duties as assigned.


Requirements

Physical Requirements


Regularly uses a keyboard/mouse to interact with a computer.
Regularly required to communicate verbally and via writing.
Occasionally lifts or carries objects weighing up to 20 lbs.


Responsibilities

Educational/Required Skills & Responsibilities


Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in mathematics, computer science, economics, or statistics.
Minimum five years of work-related experience.
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
Expert skills with Microsoft Office, including Excel.
Knowledge of relational databases and data warehouse concepts (Oracle).
Knowledge of data visualization best practices and principles.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.


Preferred Skills

Preferred Skills/Experience


Knowledge of Python programming language.
Advanced analytics experience, classification/predictive modeling, optimization models, and forecasting.
Proficiency in query performance tuning.


ESPO Corporation

Leaders in Technical Recruiting & Staffing since 1965

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workforce . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other attribute or protected characteristic by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are...

SafeBasements is a basement waterproofing and foundation repair service provider and product manufacturer, and an innovator in both client satisfaction and product dependability. Acquired by Percheron Capital in 2023, we are looking for talented team members to be a part of our exciting growth plans!




What we need...

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst with a strong background in business analysis and experience creating impactful data visualizations. The ideal candidate will possess a keen analytical mind, attention to detail, and the ability to transform complex data sets into clear, actionable insights through compelling visual representations.




What you'd do...




Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data and present findings to stakeholders through reports and visualizations.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing data validation and quality checks.
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data visualization and analysis.




What you'd need...

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field; relevant experience can be substituted.
2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Experience with SQL and querying databases.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.




This position is based in our office in St Louis Park, MN. Because we are in the early stages of building our Corporate team, we have found it valuable to be together in the office Monday-Thursday, and most of us work remotely on Fridays. We all have flexibility to work remotely on ad hoc days as personal demands arise.
